title: Sternberg Press Typeface
content:
Any ideas on what Sternberg Press uses for their logotype?

Thanks in advance guys!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150325201639im_/http:/typophile.com/files/wpid-1286379629logo_web_5257.jpg)

Font: 

 Perpetua (Italic) by Eric Gill [1925] 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150325201639/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [wpid-1286379629logo\_web.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150325201639/http:/typophile.com/files/wpid-1286379629logo_web.jpg) | 4.54 KB |
author: BeTheKid

comments.content: It must be **[Perpetua (Italic)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150325201639/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Adobe&ffam=Perpetua%20-%20Italic&fid=308f787b975b2f614ad2c2d544998d5d&fsize=60&text=Sternberg%20Press&fit=1)** by Eric Gill [1925]
Awesome! I'll update it as found.
